message: Hello, could anybody explain to me what the difference is between media and static? At first I thought media was for file uploads and media that is generated by users of the website. But I am using django-css and they put the sass files in media. Also just saw a post about favicons and somebody says to use /media/favicon.ico. But isn't that a static file?

I never deployed a django website but I am going to do that soon so maybe that's why I am confused. Maybe when you deploy you gather all your media files and put those in static or is that completely wrong?
The two used to be one. That changed in 1.3 which released today. It will be a while till third party applications/blog posts/etc. catch up. Your original assumptions are correct.
@emperorcezar great that clears things up, thanks man!
In 1.3+ media == user uploaded files, static == normal static content
